cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate northwest across the Yucatan Channel into the central Gulf of Mexico, then bend north-northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana–upper Texas border area).

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watches limited to western Cuba; no U.S. coastal watches yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings only for the Cayman Islands at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: No — current guidance suggests 2–4 inches for SE Texas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No — west of forecast landfall, surge likely 1–3 ft
weather_observation.wind: Chance (≈25%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) late Fri–early Sat; gusts could reach 40–45 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible near Sabine Pass depending on exact track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could bring 2–4 inches of rain with localized higher totals, causing ponding at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Short-term channel restrictions or closure due to elevated seas and wind, possible brief power interruptions.
